result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Road Track & Trailer or its employees listed in the Criminal Complaint.  
Defendant is ordered to call the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

11:28 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Eric D Wilson appeared by Zoom.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
Defendant is ordered to call the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:55 AM Defendant Eric D Wilson not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Court notes the defendant filed a letter today requesting to appear by Zoom. The State is asking for a warrant. The Court will adjourn the initial appearance. The Court will authorize a zoom appearance for the defendant at the next date. Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request for Zoom for Initial Appearance
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
